Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: Academi
Reviews.Content: The hotel has nice rooms, good breakfast, and friendly staff, but bed bugs!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service value”
Reviews.Author: Jim O
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a quad room here with our own balcony: a couple blocks off the place to catch a vaporetto to San Marcos. The price was GREAT. We had a car and the proprietor told us where we could park for free. The hotel provides a really nice breakfast with croissants, yogurt, cereal, fruit juice, and (key for me) bottomless coffee. The staff is friendly and helpful, and Lido is so much less cluttered than Venice that it was a really nice respite after a great day in the crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Venice”
Reviews.Author: Cultured_family
Reviews.Content: Our room was a bit cramped but then we are a family of four, so in a way that's out fault. For me the bed was too hard but that is a matter of taste. Extra pillows were given as soon as I asked. Good continental breakfast, as much as i wanted. This hotel is really convenient for the Lido ferry to Venice main island and scrupulously clean. We could walk to the ferry terminal in less than 5 minutes and be at St marks with in 15 mins of leaving the door and its just great to approach by boat. Do get a boat pass, its 50 Euros for the week but we could hip on and off whenever we wanted. Kids are cheaper and there is a rolling Venice deal for 14-26 year olds. The restaurants in Lido are reasonable and cheaper than the main island. beware of contori. They say no service charge then instead add 2 Euros ahead contori (cover charge...) a bit of a fiddle. We arrived by Aliaguna boat from the airport 15 Euros each. It is cheaper to get a bus to Piazza Roma and then get a vaporetto but we just wanted the fun of arriving by boat. Yes if we go back (which we will) we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: travoholic_me
Reviews.Content: The hotel was basic. room was fairly clean, but the both the sink and the shower in the washroom were clogged up and wouldnt drain properly. Room was small, but it was nice that we had a room with a balcony. The staff was very helpful when we asked about how to get to places. Breakfast was simple, but good. Location is a little far from the main attractions and it does take a while to get to the main island, but at least the hotel is close to the vaporetto stop

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly H
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel; it's a great choice for visiting Venice. The water taxi stop is a 5-minute walk, so you can be on St. Mark's Square in less than 20 minutes. There are several restaurants and gelato shops nearby (and all the ones we visited were very good). We had a beautiful, quiet, spacious room with a balcony overlooking the main street. The staff was very nice and gave helpful tips. They also allowed us to check out the night before, so we could just leave our key with the night porter when we had to depart at 3:30 AM for our early-morning flight. As others have said, the breakfast is decent (not great). Overall, highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: bramasole5
Reviews.Content: Its a good basic hotel which finds itself in a good location (on the main street of Lido and 5 minutes walk from the vaporetto stop) and they offered a really great price for the room considering the time of year I took my trip (September). The room was on a small side (and since it was a twin room it can be considered a really small one). The good thing was that it had both a fan and air conditioner so it was a perfect shelter from the outside heat. However, it had 2 negatives about it - the windows that didn't let much daylight in (the classic case of room pictures you can find online being those of their best rooms and not necessarily matching the room you might get) and a TV with a really annoying stand-by light which was huge, very bright (so much so that it was never really dark in the room) flashing red and blue all night and impossible to turn off even if you unplugged the TV from the wall. The breakfast was pretty average but what I really loved was the possibility to have it in the garden which made for a perfect start of each day. The hotel's entrance can be a little tricky to find at first, so look up for the hotel's name on its wall and then head into the narrow passage between a fence and the sweets shop that finds itself on the ground floor of the building.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Hotel Cristallo!”
Reviews.Author: lyndagrant
Reviews.Content: One night stay, but made very confortable. Arrived at 11am to a friendly welcome, non of the "your rooms not ready til 2pm". Case taken to room with a smile. One inside we relaxed, nice airy room, crisp white linen and took a nap after our very early start. Room and bathroom high standard for price paid. Staff most helpful, aiding us with water boat timetables and just about anything else we asked. Couple of minutes walk to the lido itself right amongst the bars and shops, but not noisy. We had to leave early so they got the coffee and breakfast early for us, Top marks for customer service and very happy to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: LHMOMLorton_Virginia
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The location was in the heart of Lido and we walked to everything. The owner was very kind and helpful. Lido was a great spot away from the touristy Venice area. 10 minute boat ride to St Mark's square was easy and scenic. The breakfast was delicious!

Reviews.Title: “venice again”
Reviews.Author: ashlea
Reviews.Content: I have been to Venice several times over the years but this is the first ime I have stayed on the Lido.I'm so pleased that I did .I'd booked another hotel in Venice city but due to an unexpected garage bill decided to look to see if I could save money and hotels on the Lido were better priced and more available.The Cristallo stood out from the reviews and I wasn't disappointed.Easy to find(altho' I missed the entrance at first as it is down a little alley), my requested quiet room was just that,was a good size with a double bed ,good storage, a well equipped bathroom and aircon and safe.Only slight downside ,no fridge.One of the best rooms I have had as a single traveller. It was lovely at the end of the day to sail across from the city and find tree lined avenues, no huge crowds and far too many ice cream stalls.The breakfast at the Cristallo was more than adequate and the dining room bright and fresh.The reception staff were great,very pleasant and very helpful.Altogether a good experience and I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice location!”
Reviews.Author: ChristineandBrendon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights only. It's a nice hotel and we'd recommend it. The rooms are spacious, clean and homely. The bathroom is big enough, although on our second night we had no hot water which was the only drawback. The location is great. It is really easy to get to Venice via boat. A 2 day pass cost us 28 Euro though, so not the cheapest ride (if you're on a budget). But it is nice to come back to much quieter Lido after a day in busy Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location, convenient for Venice”
Reviews.Author: MKMapman
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Cristallo is on the main street from the waterbus stop crossing the island of Venice Lido. Despite this, it is a quiet hotel, with small yet clean rooms. The buffet breakfast was acceptable, if a little limited in scope (no fruit), and the free in room internet worked fine. It's a decent choice if you want stay close to Venice on a budget, especially a little out of season when Lido is quiet. Reception was friendly and spoke English fluently and not bothered by the fact that a delay to my flight meant that I didn't arrive until 200am. And if you miss the last waterbus from Marco Polo airport, you may be able to get a (road) bus to Piazzale di Roma in Venice, and then take the all night vaporetto that runs across to the Lido.

Reviews.Title: “excellent - again”
Reviews.Author: serenissimabelgio
Reviews.Content: Third time at this hotel, and still great. Great location, great value for money, friendly and helpful staff, well kept hotel in general. Never before had we such hot weather as this year , which made us appreciate the Cristallo even more, with its fresh common areas and efficient airco in the room. The children enjoyed it very much too - again - and we spent all day at the beach, only going into Venice after 5pm. This way, despite the extreme temperatures, we all had a great holiday.

Reviews.Title: “very good choice”
Reviews.Author: fitz_roch
Reviews.Content: as already mentionned, staying on Lido island is nice and hotel Cristallo is part of the enjoyment ... Simple and very clean...room and bathroom of reasonable size...good buffet breakfast taken on a nice terrace....all contributed to a lovely 3 nights stay on the beautiful and interesting island of Lido... A. Roch

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: KitKatHoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night while touring Venice. A simple, clean hotel with a good location. Lots of good restaurants in the area. The hotel provides you access to a private beach. We went to the public beach which as very nice. Unfortunately, we slept in and missed the included breakfast so are unable to comment.

Reviews.Title: “Superb...how can it only be 2 star?”
Reviews.Author: philandlarysa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights this July. Great value for money at around Â£220 for two for three nights B&B. It is described as two star.....but I assume this is because it doesnt meet some obscure criteria....here are the positives; open all night (we checked in at nearly midnight), we emailed requesting a balcony room and got it; massive double bed (king size +); linen changed every day; quality ensuite bathroom with 4 or 5 fresh towels each day; perfectly adequate continental breakfast taken in enclosed garden; 5 minutes from vaporetto link to Venice (10 mins) Airport (25 mins); 5 mins from Lido beach with free access to hotel's beach cabin; great location amongst Lido's pizzerias and ice cream/coffee shops, air con, period building, helpful staff. Negatives; none. Staying on the Lido was a masterstroke as door to door hotel to St Marks square was 30 mins walk and boat, and it meant after a hot day walking in Venice we could escape to the beach for a couple of hours for a swim and either enjoy an evening in this elegant resort or head back into Venice for dinner. If you are on a budget and Venice is too expensive to use as a base I would recommend Cristallo as a worthy alternative and thus combine the city break with a beach break too!

Reviews.Title: “excellent price quality ratio”
Reviews.Author: jChristof
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, helpful staff (speaking english, spanish and french at least), great location (close to the Lido beach and 10mn away from San Marco piazza by vaporetto), good breakfast, free internet... it's not a palace, of course, but it has everything you need to enjoy ur stay in Venezia The hotel is ranked in the top 100 - for a 2 stars hotel not situated in Venezia, it says it all..

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Venice-Lido”
Reviews.Author: Lopa_Shah
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, conveniently located on main road. Waterbus Vaporetto station at a walking distance, convenient for sightseeing Venice and around the lagoon. Clean and Spacious rooms. Friendly staff. Lots of lovely restaurants around for dine options. Good price for it's location. Just a few blocks away, there is a public beach. And you can rent a bicycle and go around on the island on your own. They can do a bit better with the breakfast though, it was very basic.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel, best ratio price/quality”
Reviews.Author: Kami-alb
Reviews.Content: The hotel in Lido was very convenient for sightseeing Venice and around the lagoon. The hotel itself is on a very good position in Lido and it was clean, our room had a big clean bathroom, the breakfast was excellent. The price was the best possible for Venice and it justified totally our expectations. Boats to Venice were very often and in 15 minutes you are in st.Mark's I would stay there again. Not to forget, the staff was very helpful :)

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: henwot
Reviews.Content: Hotel Cristallo is a very nice hotel with super friendly staff. They spoke several languages and always helped us when we had a question or problem. Unfortunately, my friend and I forgot a little stuffed animal when we left, but the staff found it and mailed it back to our home address--super nice! The room was clean and the breakfast was just awesome. Hotel Cristallo has everything that you need and that you are looking for to enjoy a great holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Alaska2World
Reviews.Content: The reviews on this hotel are accurate. The service was great and they were very helpful, but it is right on the street and the street noise can be pretty loud. The breakfast was very filling, high quality and very good! We had two extra twin beds in the room and our teenage boys found the beds were not comfortable. Overall, it was worth the money. Other places in the area were much more expensive and we were pleased with our stay. If you order wine to be in your room, make sure you ask for it.

Reviews.Title: “A fun, funky hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: loughreagal95
Reviews.Content: I took a group of interior design students from Ireland. We needed an easy to find hotel so if anyone got lost or separated from the group, we could find each other without hassle. The great thing about staying on the Lido is all you need to do is take the vaparetto right to the one stop at the Lido, and the Hotel Cristallo is a short, straight walk up the road - so no one got really lost! There are some excellent restaurants on the main street as well and all the gelato places are to die for. If you are diabetic like me - be warned. The food and pastries are coma inducing. The breakfast was excellent with fresh sliced meats, cheeses, rolls and pastries. As well as Italian coffee. We could pig out in the morning and then only need a light lunch (a tramezzino - sandwich). Then we could get a great meal in the evening. The two Andreas' that we dealt with were so helpful. The Andreas that speaks fluent English made me so ashamed that my Italian was just so-so, as he spoke fluent French. German and who knows what other language. He gave us great directions and always had time for giving advice and help. Look, the hotel isn't fancy schmancy, but the rooms are clean, the breakfast is great and the price is reasonable - so what the heck! The boat ride to and from the Lido was short as the views of he Grand Canal each day were inspiring. Make sure you get a vaparetto passes as it is much cheaper than buying a separate ticket each time you want to go onto the vaparetto. I have been to Venice 7 times - I never get tired of it. P.S. There is a great handbag outlet that sells leather bags made in Italy very cheaply, even by American standards and especially by European standards. It is almost next to the McDonald's near the Ca D'Oro vaparetto stop,

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: MMcLiverpool
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a 5 night stay at the Cristallo. It was our first visit to Venice and booked the Cristallo from the reviews already available. The location is good, only a 5 minute walk from the vaporetta terminus one way and the beach in the opposite direction. The hotel is situated on a main road and you get some traffic noise. We had a room at the front of the hotel which was quite large and bright with a modern very clean bathroom with shower. There are several shops,restaurants, bars and ice cream parlours close by. The continental breakfast was very fresh with sufficient variety. The waitress cleaned the tables promptly and was constantly renewing the food. The staff were helpful and friendly. The appearance of the public areas of the hotel is typically italian in that the decor is quite dark and ornate but clean. I would recommmend staying on the Lido. It is only a 10 minute vaporetta ride across to the hustle and bustle of Venice and when the weather is good the beach is ideal. We were lucky to have good weather during our stay. We arrived in Venice,Treviso late at night. There is a bus directly outside the airport which will take you to the Pl. Roma, it has Ryanair on the front window but can be used by anyone (you can purchase a single or return ticket 6 or 10 euros from a machine at the airport (in the baggage reclaim area). You can also purchase the tourist travel card at the airport. These are good value as you purchase them for either 3, 4, or 7 days and they can be used on all travel within Venice. We didn't know this before arriving and found it stressful trying to purchase a ticket and find the correct vaporetta station. At night the no. 51 vaporetta will take you to the Lido from Pl. Roma, the journey takes about 20 minutes. During our stay we used the no.1 vaporetta from the Lido to travel along the Grand Canal, but it stops at every location and the journey can be slow.

Reviews.Title: “very shabby”
Reviews.Author: Curly003
Reviews.Content: Brown and dark green depressing colors. Had a window to the street which was a good thing. Breakfast buffet consisted of packaged toast, coffee, cereal and yogurt which was quite substantial for an Italian breakfast in any 3 star hotel. Water in shower was poor. very basic and ugly place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: ALANandYAMILE
Reviews.Content: Yes, this is a 2-star hotel, so it doesn't have the chandeliers or the fitness center or the business rooms, but who cares. It has great location, the rooms are clean and the staff is friendly and helpful. If we visit Venice in the future, we would definitely stay at the Cristallo again. Alan & Yamile Florida,USA

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and perfectly located to explore Venice”
Reviews.Author: AleksandraB
Reviews.Content: Me and my mom stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and really enjoyed it! The hotel is perfectly located in the middle of the main street, 5-10 minutes away from the beach and 5-10 minutes away from the boat stop (vaporetto takes you to San Marco square in 10 minutes, 40 minutes to the train station S. Lucia). There are lots of restaurants, cafes and shops around (including a supermarket Billa). The hotel was clean, quiet, the staff was super friendly and breakfast offered a good selection of things to choose from (different teas, good coffee, cereals, jam, cheese, cold meat, croissants, yoghurts, juice). Free WiFi and an access to the hut on the beach made things more comfortable and pleasant. It was so nice to return to a quiet island after the busy day of sightseeing and enjoy a long swim in the warm sea!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location quite and clean”
Reviews.Author: GRONJ
Reviews.Content: this lido hotel is perfect ; nice to be away from the crowd at night ! perfectly located 15/20 minutes away by boat from San Marco, this hotel is very clean A/C equiped,nice friendly team, very good breakfast in a nice patio. On top, room price is very correct . We spent 4 nights there and will certainly come back Jean & Catherine

Reviews.Title: “Superb location - a great value budget option in Lido”
Reviews.Author: fll7jkh
Reviews.Content: This is a good budget option in Lido, nice and cheap for its excellent location and it relation to its neighbours. It is positioned almost exactly half way down Viale Santa Maria Elisabetta making it equi-distant from the pier where the boat drops you off from Venice and the main beach along the south of Lido: a 10 minute walk in each direction. This also places it right in amongst all the nice local restaurants. The entrance area and reception looks rather dated but the rooms whilst not the most modern, are comfy, well appointed and very clean. The owners are extremely helpful and welcoming. The hotel owns a hut on the beach, only one mind. This is free to use by guests although potentially there could be a handful of you there vying for the facilities. We used it all 3 days we were there and thankfully only had to share it with one other couple so there was enough space and seating for all of us!

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a hotel....!”
Reviews.Author: raceycasey5
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd visit to Venice, 2nd to the Lido. When we come back for our 4th visit we will most definitely come back to this hotel. It has to have had the cleanest room and bathroom of any hotel I have stayed in. We were in a triple room facing the main road. The room size was absolutely fine, the bathroom wasn't huge, by it didn't need to be. It had a fantastic shower! Breakfast, served between 8am and 10am, was certainly not to be missed. Rolls, pastries, jams, proper tea and coffee, cereal, cold meats, yoghurts, you would not go hungry! It was always fresh and all very tasty indeed! The staff were superb, so friendly and helpful and full of recommendations. Andrea quello colpevole, and Andrea la magro!! Two fantastic guys! Thanks to both of them for making our stay that much more enjoyable. We think this hotel is the perfect base for a trip to Venice, just 15 mins on the Vaporetto to the City and surrounded by good bars, ristorante and gelateria! It is superb value for money. We would not consider another hotel after staying here.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent place to explore Lido”
Reviews.Author: DagurPele
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nites. Our room was a bit small, but functional with a comfortable bed. The staffs were specially caring and friendly. Breakfast included with many options. Good location, it is a few steps to water bus service which can take us easily to all the main sites we needed. An excellent place to explore Lido. To be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel close to the Lido stop”
Reviews.Author: qkslvr0305
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel located close to the ferry stop. The breakfast was good and plenty to get you through until lunch. Staff was super friendly and when I had to go to the pharmacy even offered to interpret for me if I had any problems. Yes we did get bug bites but that was because it was pouring one night and we left our window open. This wasn't specific to this hotel or even Venice (we also got plenty of bites in Paris so if you're going remember to take bug spray!!!). There was no problem getting wi-fi in the hotel (6 euro for an hour or 9 euro for the whole day). The room was surprising large for Europe and modestly decorated. Only problem we had was very minor. We ordered a triple room and when we got there the third bed (which folds into the wall) was locked. The night staff took care of it right away though. I highly recommend this hotel if you want to stay on the Lido but i'd probably stay directly in Venice next time.

Reviews.Title: “We fell in love with Lido”
Reviews.Author: Travelingotter
Reviews.Content: Hotel Cristallo is a great place to stay on Lido. We were there Oct 9-12 We had a corner room (#22) with a Bathtub/Shower combo - a real treat for me. We had huge windows overlooking a green area and we could also see the street. Easy walk from the Lido Vaporreto stop AND an easy walk to the beach. Roxy is a great family type restaurant just a few doors from the Hotel and across the street is Rizzo a great deli/bakery. Gelato is up and down the street - we found a gelato called Venician for 1 euro - orange flavored with chocolate flakes and orange peel that we had every night. Breakfast at the hotel was good - no eggs or fruit though. Clean rooms and they have an elevator. Staff very helpful and friendly. We would definitely stay here again - Lido is much quieter than Venice - get the Venice Connect card for the travel from Lido to Venice for the length of your stay - it is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: muzbergs
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Hotel Cristallo. Yes, it's not in the heart of Venice but you just jump on the vaporetto and in 10 minutes you're wherever you want to be. We did not find the street noise to be excessive and were very comfortable there. Andreas, the manager, was extremely helpful and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Venice but not most convenient”
Reviews.Author: jwvdkiv
Reviews.Content: This well priced pension is great value. POSITIVES: Many local restaurants near with good value. Rooms are clean. Quiet. Good overall condition. Room was in good condition. Breakfast was delicious. Near the beach. NEGATIVES: No direct relation with Expedia. Thought room was already prepaid. Busy season at least half hour from train station. If you want to be in San Marco it is at least 15 minute ferry ride. Venice is pricey. The area where this hotel is is much less expensive than San Marco area. There are a number of water ferries to Lido. However, it is the last stop. Staff was courteous. Area was very safe and tourist friendsly. At least 6 restaurants within a few blocks. Two cash machines with in two blocks. Only three blocks from water ferry stop. Beach is an easy walk. Many gelaterias near. I would stay there again but try to avoid August. Way too hot. The room was nicely air conditioned and no noise from the unit. Not the most up-to-date on interior. neighborhood was quiet. Our room looked out on street and no noise at night.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: mcmikeec
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a great trip in Venice and to be honest we were a bit disappointed with the Hotel Cristallo. The room was very basic and the furniture dating from the 70's. But what do you expect? - you get what you pay for. On a positive note, the hotel was clean and the breakfast was OK. The hotel is only a few mins walk to the ferry stop, so very convenient for getting into Venice. Overall, if you are looking for somewhere cheap to act as a base for a trip to Venice then this is the place for you. If you want somewhere romantic - go somewhere else!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location...But......”
Reviews.Author: VaTravelleers
Reviews.Content: Our family visited Venice in August and suffered in a hot room at the Hotel Cristallo. We booked a quad with an extra bed but upon arrival we were told only a quad was available but that we could have a quad and a double for a small amount more. The AC did not work which is very common in Italy. The beds lack box springs. The positives of the hotel are the location and breakfeast buffet. You will be using the vaporetto daily so there is no need to stay directly in Venice and pay the higher food and lodging costs.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: serenissimabelgio
Reviews.Content: Thanks to reviews on this site, I preferred this hotel to some 3 star hotels that were also slightly more expensive, and we didn't regret our decision one single second ! We already stayed in all kinds of hotels, ranging from 1 to 5 stars, but this hotel really has it all: unbeatable price/quality , ideal location within 5 min walk from beach and vaporretti to Venice, large and comfortable rooms (ours was room 24 with balcony and nice view on the buzzy Gran Viale), good breakfast ( we had plenty of 3 star hotels with much less variety and quality ....), and nice atmosphere with friendly staff. A pitty we could only stay 2 nights....... This was our 11th stay in Venice and 3rd on Lido, and we surely return to this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous little hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: jubline
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in July. I initially picked it due to the favourable reviews on here, but the price was what made me finally book it. We booked through the hotel's own website and had a large ensuite double room for 3 nights for 70 Euro's per night. The Hotel is located around 200m from the Vaporetto stop. The boats travel from here all over the mainland Venice and to the surrounding islands. We never waited longer than about 8 minutes for a boat at any time. The hotel is on the Santa Maria Elizabetta road which is the main road from the Vaporetto stop to the beach. You can walk the entire length of the road in about 10 minutes. Our room was large, simply furnished with windows on either side. The views weren't especially inspiring, but not offensive and the room was lovely and light as a result of the 2 windows. The bed was large and comfortable with a firm mattress (which I prefer). The ensuite was large and the shower larger than many Italian showers that I have encountered before. There was even a bidet which came in handy for washing sandy feet! The room lacked 2 things. A mirror (there was only one in the bathroom) and a fridge. That aside, we weren't desperate for either. There was a very handy safe (free of charge) and the satellite TV had BBC world and CNN in English (not that we watched much television). The air conditioning was a welcome relief from the stifling heat and the overhead fan was great when getting to sleep. The rooms were spotless and we had absolutely no problems during our stay. The 2 members of staff that we encountered (both on reception) were friendly and helpful. We didn't eat breakfast in the hotel (we had too much to do and too much sleep to catch up on!), but the rooms and garden that breakfast was served in looked lovely. There is a lift so anyone with heavy bags will have no problems. Our room was on the 2nd floor and was at the back of the hotel so we had no noise from the road. I would imagine that the rooms at the front may be a little noisier, but can't say for sure. We were in room 28. During our stay we travelled a lot over to Venice. We ate there many times, but also ate on the SM Elizabetta near to the hotel. There are several bars / restaurants which were still open at 2:00am. These serve pizza and snacks as well as drinks, ice-cream and cocktails. We found all of the local places that we ate and drank in to be fine and not as expensive as mainland Venice. I will review these places separately. The advice that I got here on tripadvisor was invaluable, especially the help with the travelling. It had been a long time since I was here last and I was Nervous about using public transport to get too and from the airport. When we arrived at Marco Polo airport (at 21:30 on a Friday) we bought our 72 hour ACTV tickets from the stand near to the exit. The passes were 33 euro's each. We caught the number 5 bus from the airport (remember to validate your ticket in the yellow box on the bus the first time that you use it). The trip to the Piazalle Roma took around 20 minutes. We then walked to the left and found the stands for the boats to the Lido. We caught the 51, but could have caught the number 1 too. The boat trip took around 35 minutes and we were in the hotel and out again with our first beer by 23:00! Here is some information on the prices of things that we bought. Drinks: My husband is not a wine drinker. We found that the beer prices were higher than home, but the quality of the beer was very good. The prices ranged from 3 euro's for half a litre up to 10 euro's for a litre of Nasto Azzurro or similar beer. Wine was around 5-8 euro's for half a litre. We didn't drink any cocktails, but the prices ranged around 5-7 euro's. We had some great drinks in the Campo San Margherita which was a great place for a spot of people watching. We ate a few times in Ferrovia which has great pizza and is generally cheaper than the other area's. We found some lovely bars in some non-touristy areas all over the island. We had a few hours on the beach and in the sea. The free beach is at the top of the SM Elizabetta road. We just took towels and lay on the sand. We had a swim too, but the sea isn't very clear. Ok for cooling off in. The Vaporetti run all night so you can stay really late in Venice and still get back for a nightcap on the Lido. When we come to Venice again, hopefully in not too long a time, we will definitely stay in the Hotel Cristallo and I would recommend it to anyone that is looking for non-fancy, comfortable accommodation at an excellent rate. Please feel free to email me if you have any questions .

Reviews.Title: “what else you can think of?”
Reviews.Author: vafa
Reviews.Content: We (me, my wife and 2 boys of 12 and 17) stayed at hotel Cristallo (Venice - Lido) for 2 nights. It is charming. while it is in an old building, but it has been renovated and gives you the impression of a historical place with facilities you expect from a good place to stay. Large rooms, great location, (5 minutes walk to the public transport in one direction, and 5 minutes walk to the beach in another direction), quiet and very friendly atmosphere, lovely neighborhood, good value for money (85 Euros/night /double, with breakfast), is what you can expect. The old fashion elevator, works better than those new and up to date ones, with almost no noise and vibration. Wifi is available in all floors, breakfast, which includes all the basic things, is served in a small yard behind the building, which makes you ready for your daily plan, weather to Venice or the beach. Andrea, the reception guy, is most helpful and honest person I have ever seen. He helps you, not as a receptionist, but as a friend. Bathrooms were extremely clean and modern. TV was a bit small, but the view of our rooms, looking to the street was nice. small sitting area, in front of the reception was very friendly and warm. It would be really hard to find a negative point to mention about this place. Booked through their own website and had no problems for check in, the rooms was next to each other, exactly as we requested.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: IrinaBirmingham
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at Hotel Cristallo. Our plane was delayed at Marco Polo airport so arrived after midnight via Alilagunda ferry boat. Staff were on duty at reception and we were given room keys. Room rather old-fashioned but clean and with modern bathroom. For us the most important thing was that it was quiet so we could get a good night's sleep. Breakfast was in the small but pleasant garden. Food average but adequate. Hotel has a beach hut so we were able to change and use the facilities on the otherwise expensive beach of the Lido. The vapporetto stop for Venice is about 5 mins. walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DowningUk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to Venice before and loved it. We decided to take our youngest daughter who is 11 and so had to do the trip on a budget as there were three of us to pay for. We decided on this hotel as it has the best of both worlds: Venice only 10/15 mins by water bus and yet the family orientated lido with access to the beach. Hotel and Room - no frills and basic, yet extremely clean and comfortable. The mattresses and pillows were great. Our room was roomy for venice, on the third floor facing the main road and had a fan, air conditioning and double glazing to keep the noise out. The en-suite had obviously been recently reburbished to a high standard. All this for E110 a night for three people we thought was very good value for money. Also there is a Billa supermarket on the way to/from the water bus stop to the hotel which is great for getting supplies, wine etc. Breakfast - Really great plentiful continental breakfast with bread rolls, cheeses, meats, jams, pastries, cereals, orange juice, coffee which is frequently topped up by a very pleasant lady which is set in a nice ground floor room with access to a small garden. Staff - really pleasant and very helpful. Beach - about a 10 min walk with access to the hotel's beach hut to change in and some deck chairs and communal shower facilities. We used this for a couple of hours after a tiring few hours in Venice - perfect for relaxing. Hints and Tips Buy your transport cards from Venice Connect at a discount price. We collected ours at Piazzo Roma on arrival from Treviso airport by coach, but there are various places that the cards can be collected. Do try the Tourist Menus with 'service charge included' as they are really good value for money. We had two meals near to the railway station quarter as it is better value for money than the main areas - delicious two course meal, litre of wine, soft drink, bread rolls and including a tip E60 - E65 for three. Be warned - on our last day we had three basic pizzas, a beer, two soft drinks and was ripped off for E48 as there was a cover charge for the tablecloth, cutlery etc and service charge included - I would advise to check if service charge is included or there is a cover charge and how much a beer costs as we were charged E12! Do meander the back streets and do not just stick to the trourist areas as they are just as lovely.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Cristallo is wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Michigan51
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hotel Cristallo was excellent. Our room was exceptional and the staff was extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A great bargain in Lido”
Reviews.Author: ceccoman
Reviews.Content: If you mind your budget more than frills, amenities and nice room decoration, Cristallo is the way to go. Located in the very center of Lido, the hotel can be easily reached by foot from the vaporetto pier, the staff is extremely nice (ask them for a room with a windowed bathroom) and, most important since it's Venice, the price is a bargain. The rooms nothing special indeed but very clean, breakfast is served at ground floor, there is also the opportunity to sit outside in a very little garden. Unfortunately they don't serve true espresso coffee but the rest is quite ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great place! Great Value and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: gandalfy2k
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is charming with unpretentious but very comfortable rooms with a very nice view. The included breakfast is good with a selection of hams and salamis and cereal and good pastry. The place is on the Lido, so you will get to enjoy the best of both worlds: the dynamic life of Venice and the tranquility of the Lido... and don't worry about commuting, in fact that might be your best experience in Venice. Take the front seats of the Vaporetto number 1 (Venetians don't like them anyway) and enjoy the most impressive view you'll ever had of any city..... In Paris you would pay a lot of money for a "Bateau Mouche" to be able to see the views from the river.... in Venice that's included in the prince of the public transportation!! The Hotel is great, the staff polite and very helpful and the price is a bargain... you'll fill like if you're staying in a much more expensive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel Cheap”
Reviews.Author: piperpur
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many hotels where the picture on the website were either photo shopped or 20 years old, but the Cristallo is just as beautiful in person as it is in the pictures. Its easy to find straight off the water taxi, and is an easy walk even with luggage. It is very convenient to places to eat, shop and the beach, and accessible by water taxi to everywhere else. The rooms are small, but serviceable, and the beds were comfortable. We did get some street noise on the weekend (we were on the front street) but it was much better after we closed the shutters. With the shutters closed and the ac on, the noise was well masked. We stayed in a triple, and as another reviewer remarked, the third bed is a fold down and not very easy to manage. it was fine for my niece, but I think it would be uncomfortable for an adult. Overall, a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: actsci99
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. The hotel is on Lido, which is away from the crowds of Venice... but it is still quick and easy to get to the main places in Venice using the boat/bus. The hotel staff was wonderful and the room was big and bright. Breakfast was served in the morning. We stayed for three nights and paid about 90 euros per night. I would fully recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “"Great Choice" Manchester UK.”
Reviews.Author: Saddletravel
Reviews.Content: We had previously enjoyed a short break on Lido and decided to return at short notice but were unable to book the same hotel. After reading all the reviews and comments on various hotels we chose the Hotel Cristallo due to its position for all the amneties and close proximity to the ferry terminal for our three day stay and found it to be an excellent choice. We had a spacious and clean room (No 23) with a newly refurbished bathroom on the front of the hotel and although overlooking the main street was really quiet. As mentioned in the other reviews all the staff were really friendly and the facilities were excellent for this grade of hotel making our stay thoroughly enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: sil2008
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hotel Cristallo was very nice. Our evaluation (1 to 5 â€“ five the best) is as follows: - Room: large enough and clean, although the furniture a little old (4 points). - Bathroom: totally new (5 points). - Breakfast: orange juice, different types of croisants, yogurts, and very nice terrace (4 points). - Situation / Area: very close to the vaporetto stop in Lido which is a very nice island, 10 minutos from Piazza San Marco by vaporetto (5 points). - Reception: Andrea Leone is attending the reception. He is one of the best receptinist Iâ€™ve ever known. He gave us many tips for our stay in Venice (5 points).

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a Venice stay”
Reviews.Author: traveldux
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Cristallo in early April. Travelling with a young family we decided to stay on Lido as was a bit quieter at that time of the year. The Lido was about 40 minutes water taxi ride from the main train station and the hotel is a few minutes walk from the water taxi stop. We really like the quiter, more relaxed atmosphere of the Lido and there were enough local restautants to suit our needs. The hotel was small but room was spacious and clean. We found the locality to be very quiet (important with young kids) and the hotel management very helpful. Breakfast was good with plenty of coffee! Whilst it was only 5 minutes across to St Marks Square, the best thing was that at the end of the day we could get away from the crowds and travel back to Lido's quiter streets.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: CrazzyDiamond
Reviews.Content: With only a few steps from water bus service, the hotel was ideally located on the Lido for our short stay in Venice. The air-conditioned rooms were clean and comfortable and the staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “great Hotel Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChrisK36
Reviews.Content: Just arrived home after a wonderful 4 day stay in Venice and knowing we we're coming back each day to the lovely Hotel Cristallo made it all that better. Welcoming staff, comfortable room and Bathroom and a cute little lift, loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Not fancy but fairly priced”
Reviews.Author: LAGinagirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a night last summer (7/07) based on the previous travellers' reviews. Most of them were pretty much on the mark: not fancy, NO frills, barebones furnishing. But, the location worked very well for us - we had a rental car that we were hesitant to leave on the mainland and we wanted to stay away from the chaos and crowds of traditional Venice. We very much enjoyed exploring Lido Is as well as the various vaperotto rides to some of the other islands. Obviously, don't consider visiting Venice w/o knowing in advance that just about everything is expensive. If you go with the mindset that you will drop a nice chunk of cash during your time there, you'll have a wonderful time. I definitely recommend this property IF you don't mind staying in a very plain room.

Reviews.Title: “Little Jewel on Lido”
Reviews.Author: kathieaz
Reviews.Content: A recommend by a third party and seven of us met up her from 9/27 - 9/30/07. Our trio shard a triple. Only downside was the hard bed that dropped on hinges from the wall. A bit low to the floor which made for difficulty getting off of it. Otherwise the place was very clean and the proprietor and other staff were very friendly and helpful. Location is great and gets you away from the noise and crowds of Venice. Short ride on the ferry to Venice, Murano and Burano and other islands. Lots to do. For families there is an arcade just a short walk down the street, close to the Adriatic beach, bicycle rentals are available, horse drawn carriage rides, good food and shopping. Just a fun place to be. Seemed to be very family friendly. The hotel serves probably the best breakfast of the seven places we stayed at over 12 days. Fresh juice, great coffee, croissants, bread, cheese, proscuitto, yogurt - in a very nice breakfast room. Can't say enough about the Hotel Cristallo, and definitely recommend it as it was great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “REALLY NICE PLACE”
Reviews.Author: Sean B
Reviews.Content: Just back from three day stay. I thought this hotel was excellent value. Rooms exceptionally clean and staff extremly helpful. The hotel is only a ten minute ferry trip from St Marks Square

Reviews.Title: “The best choise we could made, for exploring Venice”
Reviews.Author: GabbeDutch
Reviews.Content: Traveling with our own car, we found the Cristallo the best choise we could made. Also based on the reviews from other quests. It was no problem to find the ferry that was bringing us with our car to the Lido. After arriving on the Lido it was a only 3 minutes drive to the hotel. There was a place in the garage for us, so we didn't have to worry about the car and all the Italiaan treasures we collected untill that time. The staffmember at the frontdesk was very informative. We had a nice room that was very clean. The bathroom was a little bit small, but everything we needed was there. The location of the hotel is good. In a couple of minutes walking there is the vaporetto. The waterbus brings you in about 15 minutes to town. We bought a 3 day card for 30 euro and could catch every boat we wanted. It was very nice to come back at the Lido after a day full of sightseeing in Venice. Tip. Don't stay to long at San Marco or Rialto. Make walkings trough the city, and you will find a quiet Venice without the crowds. Tip. Just have a look at the famous cafÃ© Florian at San Marco. But do not buy an espresso on the terasse. We had to pay 22 euro for 2 espresso's, including the music!

Reviews.Title: “Decent enough hotel- but note....”
Reviews.Author: samrg
Reviews.Content: Three of us including a teenager stayed at Cristallo for two nights and found previous reviews reasonably accurate. The accommodation, whilst no frills two star, was clean and roomy; the staff extremely helpful and the breakfast very good. However prospective guests should note the additional cost of ferrying back and forward to the mainland of Venice, unless of course you choose to stay out on the Lido. The vaporetti water buses are not cheap especially for a family. At our time of staying the water bus would have cost 36 Euro for a return trip for three from the Lido to say San Marco. There are 24 hour and 48 hour deals but still not cheap. There is something of a faded grandeur verging on seaside tackiness about the Lido itself though aspects of this may appeal to kids. If you really want to visit the beach then make use of Cristallo's private beach cabin, but note that the hotel itself is not adjacent to the sea.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: amandaksmith
Reviews.Content: Booked with hotel itself having stayed here before, better prices and room a/v. Room 33 is good with 3 windows out to the front no noise. There a plenty of places to eat within short walk of the hotel, all good food and value. Hotel breakfast good, eggs which my husband likes and usual continental stuff with good coffee. Supermarket opposite for drinks etc We have fpound the Lido a fab place to stay and a couple of hours on the beach makes a welcome for tired feet. 10 mins on the water bus to st marks and a fab view all the way. Less than 5 mins walk to vaporetti stop. All in all, good value, clean, helpful and going back next week for 3rd time!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accommodations in Venice”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinEnthusiast
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cristallo March 24-26 and had a wonderful time. Lido is such a quaint and charming island. I had my concerns with the distance from Venice, but it's only an extra 10 minute boat ride to the Lido pier. The restaurants and pizzarias were excellent and very close to the hotel. Our room was very clean, spacious (considering European standards) and on a corner so we had three windows; it was lovely. We also had a newly renovated bathroom that was very nice. I cannot say enough about the hotel and its manager on duty (ANDRE) during our stay. He was extremely accommodating and was of particular assistance to us when we did not confirm our water taxi reservation to the airport early enough in the evening before we left Venice. He went out of his way to try to confirm our reservation after hours. To provide us some sense of comfort he mapped out an alternate public transportation route to get to the airport in plenty of time to make our flight. Fortunately our water taxi arrived as scheduled. I recommend stopping by Bar Maleti also on Gran Viale S. Maria Elisabetta. It has great food, drink, GELATO and internet service. I would recommend the Cristallo to anyone.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Cristallo -- Lido
HotelInfo.Address: Gran Viale Santa Maria Elisabetta 51 | Lido, 30126 Venice, Italy
